SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

atomica.logic
Class Game

java.lang.Object
  java.util.Observable
      atomica.logic.Game

public class Game
extends java.util.Observable

The class represents a running Game. A Game object can be instantiated as a new game or by loading a serialized GameSituation.

Author:
Georg Ludewig

private Game()
Default constructor for initialization. It doesn't create a valid game so it is privat.

calcScoresUntilNextLevel

public int calcScoresUntilNextLevel()
Considering the current score, this method returns the necessary score to reach the next Level.

Returns:
the necessary score to reach the next Level

checkLevelChange

private boolean checkLevelChange()
Checks if current score require to change the Level. The Level will not be changed if it is the last Level.

Returns:
true if the Level was changed

checkNewMolecules

private boolean checkNewMolecules()
This Method detects all Molecules, adds their score and removes them from the board.

Returns:
true if Molecules were detected and removed

private void addMoleculeInGame(Molecule m)

Finds a random empty Field in current GameSituation.

Returns:
an empty field

findShortestPath

public Path findShortestPath(Field from,
                             Field to)
Finds the shortest Path between the two Fields considering blocked Fields by Atoms.

Parameters:
from - the Field where to start
to - the destination Field
Returns:
the shortest Path

firstRound

private void firstRound()
Places randomly atoms and indicators if current GameSituation does not contain any token. It also assures that an initial GameSituations has the required number of indicators.

getIsGameOver

public boolean getIsGameOver()
Checks if a Game is finished.

Returns:
true if the Game is over

getRandomColors

public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> getRandomColors(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> colors2Exclude,
                                                              int number,
                                                              Level level)
Creates random color indices considering the allowed colors in the given Level. As an initial GameSituation may not have the required number of IndicatorTokens, this method is used to get the colors of the additional IndicatorTokens.

Parameters:
colors2Exclude - excluding colors which are not allowed to create
number - the number of colors that shall be created
level - the Level for which random colors shall be created
Returns:
an ArrayList with random color indices

getRandomColors

public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> getRandomColors(Level level)
Creates random color indices considering the allowed colors in the given Level.

Parameters:
level - the Level for which random colors shall be created
Returns:
an ArrayList with random color indices

Returns the number of rows in current GameSituation.

the number of rows

Returns the score of current GameSituation.

getSituation

public GameSituation getSituation()
Returns the current GameSituation.

Returns:
the current GameSituation

moveAtomToken

public boolean moveAtomToken(AtomToken atom,
                             Field destinationField)
Moves an AtomToken to the given destination Field. If there is a path to the Field and the AtomToken could be placed, this Method returns true.

If by moving the AtomToken no Molecule was detected or all Atoms are removed a new Round starts. If that leads to a GameSituation without empty Fields, the Game will be set over.

Parameters:
atom - the AtomToken to be moved
destinationField - the destination Field
Returns:
true if the AtomToken could be moved to the destination Field

nextRound

private void nextRound()
Starts a new round by transforming current IndicatorToken to AtomToken, checking the situation for new Molecules and placing new Indicators.

placeNewAtoms

private void placeNewAtoms()
Places new AtomTokens considering the colors of the current Level.

placeNewIndicators

private void placeNewIndicators()
Places new IndicatorTokens considering the colors of the current Level.

queryAtomToken

public AtomToken queryAtomToken(int col,
                                int row)
Checks if there is an AtomToken on the given Position and returns it.

Parameters:
col - the column of the Field
row - the row of the Field
Returns:
the AtomToken at the given Position

queryToken

public Token queryToken(int col,
                        int row)
Checks if there is a Token on the given Position and returns it.

Parameters:
col - the column of the Field
row - the row of the Field
Returns:
the Token at the given Position

removeMoleculesFromBoard

private void removeMoleculesFromBoard(java.util.ArrayList<Molecule> molecules)
Removes all AtomTokens of the given Molecule form the current Situation.

Parameters:
molecules -

start

public void start()
Starts a Game by initializing the first round. In case an initial GameSituation without AtomTokens was loaded, it will perform a second round. That will transform current IndicatorTokens to AtomTokens.

transformIndicators

private void transformIndicators()
Transforms all IndicatorTokens of the current Situation to AtomTokens.

getMoleculeNumber

public int getMoleculeNumber()

flushTokens

public void flushTokens()
This method lets all tokens in the current game situation "fall" down. New molecules which might be created will be removed. This was an adaption from the ProPra Seminar 07.09.2008.
